courses.PBS 101 — Cal Teach: Pedagogy for Learni:
Course: PBS 101 — Cal Teach: Pedagogy for Learning Assistants
Credits: 2
Description: Supports and prepares learning assistants (LAs) for success in active classrooms. Helps LAs integrate learning theory and effective practices to facilitate thinking and learning when students work in small groups on conceptual problems. Prerequisite(s): Successful completion of the course or equivalent in which the student will serve as an LA. Concurrent participation as an LA for a University STEM course is required. Enrollment is by application via the online form and a follow-up interview for selected applicants
Requirements: No additional requirements listed.
courses.PBS 102A — Cal Teach: Advanced Pedagogy:
Course: PBS 102A — Cal Teach: Advanced Pedagogy for Learning Assistants
Credits: 1
Description: Advanced learning assistants (LAs) continue to explore learning theory and practical strategies for engaging students in thinking and learning. Prerequisite(s): PBS 101 . Enrollment is by application and by permission of instructor and is restricted to sophomores, juniors, and seniors.
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.PBS 102B — Cal Teach: Advanced Pedagogy:
Course: PBS 102B — Cal Teach: Advanced Pedagogy for Learning Assistants
Credits: 2
Description: Advanced learning assistants (LAs) explore learning theory and practical strategies for engaging students in thinking and learning. Returning LAs in this course take on an advanced project involving one or more of the following: mentoring of new LAs, data collecting, research into teaching/learning, and/or the development of learning activities. Prerequisite(s): PBS 101 . Enrollment is by permission following application and is restricted to sophomores, juniors, and seniors.
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.PBS 182 — ACE Program Service Learning:
Course: PBS 182 — ACE Program Service Learning
Credits: 2
Description: Students participate in training and development to co-facilitate collaborative learning in ACE active learning sessions and final exam review sessions. Students are role models for students pursuing science- and math-intensive majors. Prerequisite(s): Prior participation in ACE; good academic standing; no non-passing grades in prior quarter. Enrollment is restricted to sophomores, juniors, and seniors.
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.PBS 198 — Summer Undergraduate Research:
Course: PBS 198 — Summer Undergraduate Research in Science and Technology
Credits: 10
Description: Provides research experiences in STEM disciplines. Enrollment in the course requires students to be selected to the URST program or similar from PBSci. The course provides space for students to conduct research in STEM following a research proposal. Course is offered for Pass/No pass grading only. Enrollment is by permission of the instructor. Students must be selected to URST (Undergraduate Research in Science and Technology Award) or similar. Once these conditions are met, students should obtain final permission from the instructor.
Requirements: No additional requirements listed.
courses.PBS 199 — Summer Research Experience in:
Course: PBS 199 — Summer Research Experience in Science
Credits: 10
Description: Provides research experiences and mentorship in STEM disciplines. Enrollment in the course requires students to be participating in a research-oriented training program at UCSC such as MARC, CAMP, CAMINO, UC LEADS, and others. The course emphasizes research skills, scientific communication, and professional development, including presenting research findings and preparing for graduate school. Students either complete a research project in a mentor’s laboratory or participate in the PBSci Summer Research Institute. Students gain tools to advance their academic and professional goals. Course is offered for Pass/No pass grading only. Enrollment is by permission of the instructor. Students must have arrangements with a faculty mentor who will sponsor their summer research or be participating in the Summer Research Institute organized by the STEM Diversity Program team. Once these conditions are met, students should obtain final permission of the instructor.
Requirements: No additional requirements listed.
